Package wei.task

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • wei.task.Controller
  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the Controller which interacts with user, user can input commands, Controller call the methods in TaskManager, e.g. add new task, update a task, print the task, remove a task, etc.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Wei Wang

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Controller()
      Constructs a Controller, load tasks from the file: "taskList.bin", the file has to be exist in the same directly with the main entry point of the application.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addTask()
      The addTask method enables the user to add a new task to TaskManager, user will set task name, project name and due time for the new task.
      void EditTask()
      The EditTask enables the user to update a certain task in TaskManager, user can choose to modify the task name, project name, status and due time.
      void filterAProject()
      The filterAProject enables user to show tasks by a certain project name, user can specify the project name which he wants to filter.
      int getDoneTaskNumber()
      Return the number of the done tasks in the TaskManager.
      int getInt​(java.lang.String inputHint, java.lang.String errorMessage)
      Get an integer from the user, if the input is invalid, continuously reading until user input a legal integer.
      int getUndoTaskNumber()
      Return the number of the undo tasks in the TaskManager.
      void removeTask()
      The removeTask enables the user to remove a task from the TaskManager, user can specify the task id which he wants to remove.
      void saveTaskList()
      Save changes of all the current tasks into the file: "taskList.bin" with a binary format, it can be loaded next time when initialize the Controller.
      void showTaskByTime()
      The showTaskByTime will show all the tasks with the sorting order of create time.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Controller

        public Controller()
        Constructs a Controller, load tasks from the file: "taskList.bin", the file has to be exist in the same directly with the main entry point of the application. The file format has to be a binary file which contains a list of task objects, When the loading fails, an error message will be printed to the console.

    • Method Detail

      • addTask

        public void addTask()
        The addTask method enables the user to add a new task to TaskManager, user will set task name, project name and due time for the new task.

      • EditTask

        public void EditTask()
        The EditTask enables the user to update a certain task in TaskManager, user can choose to modify the task name, project name, status and due time.

      • filterAProject

        public void filterAProject()
        The filterAProject enables user to show tasks by a certain project name, user can specify the project name which he wants to filter.

      • getDoneTaskNumber

        public int getDoneTaskNumber()
        Return the number of the done tasks in the TaskManager.
        Returns:
        The number of the done tasks in the TaskManager

      • getInt

        public int getInt​(java.lang.String inputHint,
                  java.lang.String errorMessage)
        Get an integer from the user, if the input is invalid, continuously reading until user input a legal integer.
        Parameters:
        inputHint - The hint information which will print to the user.
        errorMessage - error information when the reading fails
        Returns:
        A legal integer.

      • getUndoTaskNumber

        public int getUndoTaskNumber()
        Return the number of the undo tasks in the TaskManager.
        Returns:
        The number of the undo tasks in the TaskManager

      • removeTask

        public void removeTask()
        The removeTask enables the user to remove a task from the TaskManager, user can specify the task id which he wants to remove.

      • saveTaskList

        public void saveTaskList()
        Save changes of all the current tasks into the file: "taskList.bin" with a binary format, it can be loaded next time when initialize the Controller.

      • showTaskByTime

        public void showTaskByTime()
        The showTaskByTime will show all the tasks with the sorting order of create time.
